thread.title: Amid stalemate, Wolf warns that horse racing may shut down
thread.title_full: Amid stalemate, Wolf warns that horse racing may shut down

title: Amid stalemate, Wolf warns that horse racing may shut down
text:
Wolf warns that horse racing may shut down because stalemate, troubled racing fund 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/22/15 3:14 pm EDT - Updated: 10/22/15 3:14 pm EDT 
HARRISBURG, Pennsylvania â€” Gov. Tom Wolf is warning that he may halt horse racing in Pennsylvania in a week because a state budget stalemate has compounded the troubles of the State Racing Fund. 
Wolf's spokesman told The Philadelphia Inquirer on Thursday that the four-month budget stalemate with the Legislature has left the state without the resources to prop up the fund. 
The Inquirer reports ( http://bit.ly/1OL2k9h ) that Wolf press secretary Jeff Sheridan says the administration will shut down racing Oct. 30 if a solution isn't reached before then. 
Six Pennsylvania tracks offer thoroughbred or harness racing. 
The fund pays for licensing, safety, equine laboratory operations and drug-testing of horses and is funded through a tax on horse racing wagers, which have been steadily declining for years.
